pageTitle: Practical Transformation Using XSLT and XPath by G. Ken Holman
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {411911=G. Ken Holman, the author and instructor of this material, was the founding chairman of the international XSLT/XPath Conformance Committee at OASIS in 2000, a member of the W3C working group that created XML from SGML, and the founding chairman of the international XML Conformance Committee at OASIS in 1998.  He has been teaching XSLT since before the standard was finalized in 1999., 18159=G. Ken Holman, the author and instructor of this material, was the founding chairman of the international XSLT/XPath Conformance Committee at OASIS in 2000, a member of the W3C working group that created XML from SGML, and the founding chairman of the international XML Conformance Committee at OASIS in 1998. He has been teaching XSLT since before the standard was finalized in 1999., 410535=The pre-recorded video was produced in February 2008 from excerpts from an earlier version of the PDF book.  This edition is the latest edition of the book, with up-to-date content., 21656=G. Ken Holman, the author and instructor of this material, was the founding chairman of the international XSLT/XPath Conformance Committee at OASIS in 2000, a member of the W3C working group that created XML from SGML, and the founding chairman of the international XML Conformance Committee at OASIS in 1998. He has been teaching XSLT since before the standard was finalized in 1999.}
